  78 -def using_unique_session(u): 

  79      """ 
  80      A test to determine if the user of the application is using a unique  
  81      session. Each user is permitted one unique session (one session in the 
  82      django_session table that has not yet expired). If the user exceeds 
  83      this quota, this test fails, and the user will get bounced to the login 
  84      url. 
  85   
  86      Parameters: 
  87          u - The user. May be anonymous or registered. 
  88   
  89      Returns: 
  90          True - the user is an AnonymousUser or the number of sessions open 
  91                 by the user is only 1 (one must be open to make the request) 
  92          False - the user is registered and has more than one open session. 
  93      """ 
  94      if u.is_anonymous() or u.is_superuser: 
  95          return True 
  96   
  97      sessions = Session.objects.all() 
  98      count = 0 
  99      for session in sessions: 
 100          try: 
 101              decoded = session.get_decoded() 
 102   
 103              if '_auth_user_id' in decoded and decoded['_auth_user_id'] == u.id: 
 104                  if 'activity_time' in decoded and decoded['activity_time'] < datetime.now(): 
 105                      # delete this session of mine; it is dormant 
 106                      Session.objects.filter(session_key=session.session_key).delete() 
 107                  else: 
 108                      count += 1 
 109          except SuspiciousOperation: 
 110              logger.debug("SuspiciousOperation caught while checking the number of sessions a user has open. Session key: %s", session.session_key) 
 111   
 112      # after counting all the open and active sessions, go back through 
 113      # the session list and assign the session count to all web sessions 
 114      # for this user. (do this for inactive sessions, too) 
 115      for session in sessions: 
 116          try: 
 117              decoded = session.get_decoded() 
 118              if '_auth_user_id' in decoded and decoded['_auth_user_id'] == u.id: 
 119                  websession = SessionStore(session_key=session.session_key) 
 120                  websession['count'] = count 
 121                  websession.save() 
 122          except SuspiciousOperation: 
 123              logger.debug("SuspiciousOperation caught while setting the session count on all user sessions. Session key: %s", session.session_key) 
 124   
 125      return (count <= 1)

 127 -def unique_session_or_json_redirect(function): 

 128      """  
 129      A decorator method.  Any method that accepts this decorator 
 130      should have an HttpRequest as a parameter called "request". 
 131      That request will be checked for a unique session.  If the 
 132      test passes, the original method is returned.  If the session 
 133      is not unique, then a JSON response is returned and the 
 134      client is redirected to log off. 
 135      """ 
 136      def decorator(request, *args, **kwargs) : 
 137          def return_nonunique_session_result(): 
 138              status = { 'success': False } 
 139              status['message'] = _( 
 140                  "The current user may only have one session open at a time.") 
 141              status['redirect'] = '/?msg=logoff' 
 142              return HttpResponse(json.dumps(status),content_type='application/json') 

 143   
 144          if not using_unique_session(request.user): 
 145              return return_nonunique_session_result() 
 146          else: 
 147              return function(request, *args, **kwargs) 
 148      return wraps(function)(decorator)

 150 -def is_session_available(req): 

 151      """ 
 152      Determine if a session is available. This is similar to a user test, 
 153      but requires access to the user's session, so it cannot be used in the 
 154      user_passes_test decorator. 
 155   
 156      Parameters: 
 157          req - The HttpRequest object, with user and session information. 
 158      """ 
 159      if req.user.is_superuser or req.user.is_staff: 
 160          return True 
 161   
 162      sessions = Session.objects.filter(expire_date__gt=datetime.now()) 
 163      count = 0 
 164      for session in sessions: 
 165          try: 
 166              decoded = session.get_decoded() 
 167              if (not req.user.is_anonymous()) and 'activity_time' in decoded and decoded['activity_time'] > datetime.now(): 
 168                  count += 1 
 169          except SuspiciousOperation: 
 170              logger.debug("SuspiciousOperation caught while checking the last activity time in a user's session. Session key: %s", session.session_key) 
 171   
 172      avail = count < settings.CONCURRENT_SESSIONS 
 173      req.session['avail'] = avail 
 174   
 175      return avail

 302 -def scoreplan(request, planid): 

 303      """ 
 304      Validate a plan to allow for it to be shown in the leaderboard 
 305   
 306      Parameters: 
 307          request -- The HttpRequest, which includes the user. 
 308          planid -- The plan to score. 
 309   
 310      Returns: 
 311          A JSON HttpResponse which includes a status, and if applicable, 
 312          a reason why the plan couldn't be validated 
 313      """ 
 314      note_session_activity(request) 
 315      status = { 'success': False } 
 316      plan = Plan.objects.get(pk=planid) 
 317   
 318      criterion = ValidationCriteria.objects.filter(legislative_body=plan.legislative_body) 
 319      status['success'] = True 
 320      for criteria in criterion: 
 321          try: 
 322              score = ComputedPlanScore.compute(criteria.function, plan) 
 323          except: 
 324              logger.debug(traceback.format_exc()) 
 325   
 326          if not score or not score['value']: 
 327              status['success'] = False 
 328              status['message'] = '<p>%s</p><p>%s</p>' % (criteria.get_short_label(), criteria.get_long_description() or criteria.function.get_long_description()) 
 329              break 
 330   
 331      if status['success']: 
 332          status['success'] = True 
 333          status['message'] = _("Validation successful") 
 334   
 335          # Set is_valid status on the plan 
 336          plan.is_valid = True 
 337          plan.save() 
 338   
 339      return HttpResponse(json.dumps(status),content_type='application/json')

1181          status['message'] = _('Merged %(num_merged_districts)d districts') % {'num_merged_districts': len(results)}

1183      except Exception as ex: 
1184          transaction.rollback()

1715      """

1718      This function retrieves all unlocked geometries within a geolevel 
1719      for a given plan. This function is necessary because a traditional 
1720      view could not be used to obtain the geometries in a versioned fashion. 
1721   
1722      This method accepts 'version__eq', 'level__eq', and 'geom__eq' URL parameters. 
1723   
1724      Parameters: 
1725      request -- An HttpRequest, with the current user. 
1726      planid -- The plan ID from which to get the districts. 
1727   
1728      Returns: 
1729      A GeoJSON HttpResponse, describing the unlocked simplified geometries 
1730      """ 
1731      note_session_activity(request) 
1732   
1733      status = {'type':'FeatureCollection'} 
1734   
1735      plan = Plan.objects.filter(id=planid) 
1736      if plan.count() == 1: 
1737          plan = plan[0] 
1738          version = request.POST.get('version__eq', plan.version) 
1739          geolevel = request.POST.get('level__eq', plan.legislative_body.get_geolevels()[0].id) 
1740          geom = request.POST.get('geom__eq', None) 
1741          if geom is not None: 
1742              try: 
1743                  wkt = request.POST.get('geom__eq', None) 
1744                  geom = GEOSGeometry(wkt) 
1745              # If we can't get a poly, try a linestring 
1746              except GEOSException: 
1747                  wkt = request.REQUEST['geom__eq'].replace('POLYGON', 'LINESTRING') 
1748                  wkt = wkt.replace('((', '(').replace('))', ')') 
1749                  try:  
1750                      geom = GEOSGeometry(wkt) 
1751                  except GEOSException: 
1752                      # If the line doesn't work, just don't return anything 
1753                      geom = None 
1754   
1755              # Selection is the geounits that intersects with the drawing tool used: 
1756              # either a lasso, a rectangle, or a point 
1757              selection = Q(geom__intersects=geom) 
1758   
1759              # Create a union of locked geometries 
1760              districts = [d.id for d in plan.get_districts_at_version(version, include_geom=True) if d.is_locked] 
1761              locked = District.objects.filter(id__in=districts).collect() 
1762   
1763              # Create a simplified locked boundary for fast, but not completely accurate lookups 
1764              # Note: the preserve topology parameter of simplify is needed here 
1765              locked_buffered = locked.simplify(100, True).buffer(100) if locked else None 
1766   
1767              # Filter first by geolevel, then selection 
1768              filtered = Geolevel.objects.get(id=geolevel).geounit_set.filter(selection) 
1769              # Assemble the matching features into geojson 
1770              features = [] 
1771              for feature in filtered: 
1772                  # We want to allow for the selection of a geometry that is partially split 
1773                  # with a locked district, so subtract out all sections that are locked 
1774                  geom = feature.simple 
1775   
1776                  # Only perform additional tests if the fast, innacurate lookup passed 
1777                  if locked and geom.intersects(locked_buffered): 
1778   
1779                      # If a geometry is fully locked, don't add it 
1780                      if feature.geom.within(locked): 
1781                          continue 
1782   
1783                      # Overlapping geometries are the ones we need to subtract pieces of 
1784                      if feature.geom.overlaps(locked): 
1785                          # Since this is just for display, do the difference on the simplified geometries 
1786                          geom = geom.difference(locked_buffered) 
1787                           
1788                  features.append({ 
1789                      # Note: OpenLayers breaks when the id is set to an integer, or even an integer string. 
1790                      # The id ends up being treated as an array index, rather than a property list key, and
